body.p:
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of the State of Kentucky

The undersigned Jurors who tried the Indictment against Horace Heffren at the present ter Februa- Term of the Campbell Circuit ^Court^ on a charge of accepting a Challenge to fight a duel, state that they were constrained by the evidence & the instructions to find a verdict of Guilty & that they assessed the lowest penalty known to the Law, a fine of $250. They would under the circumstances, had the law permitted, have made the fine merely nominal. They believe the said Horace Heffren is a fit subject for Executive Clemency & they therefore recommend him your Excellency to remit the fine assessed against him, believing the amount he will be compelled to pay the Attorney for the Commonwealth & the costs, will be ample punishment for the offense

Feby 20th 1862
Henry Husen
W S Walker
Jno. C Thomas
Lambert Day
John Stricker
Abe Kenney
A McKenzie
John F Herbert
Henry Buchanan
John Brown Lock
Jordan Noe Lewis Weaver

I Jno Anderson clerk of the Campbell Circuit Court certify that H. Buchanan, Lewis Weaver, J. F. Herbert, J. B. Lock, H. Huser, Abe Kinney, A McKenzie, W. S. Walker, Jordan Noe, John Stricker J C Thomas & Lambert Day whose signatures appear to the above Petition were the Jurors who tried the case menitioned therein & that I believe the signatures to be genuine. Feby 20/62
